events.name: Google I/O Extended Zagreb
events.description:
Google I/O is an annual software developer-focused conference held by Google in San Francisco, California. It features highly technical, in-depth sessions focused on building web, mobile, and enterprise applications with Google and open web technologies.

We are bringing the magic of I/O to Zagreb with I/O Extended where we will get the local developer community together to experience the keynote and other main I/O sessions, in real time.

Thanks to our friends at Five the event will be held at their HQ and of course we will provide food and drinks (beers) to survive the talks.

events.name: GDG Garage #1
events.description:
GDG Garage is an hands-on, hyperlocal & regular meeting of developers.

Hands-on means that there is no speaker. People come and work together in small groups — on whatever they feel like. Hyperlocal means it’s a neighborhood thing. If you need to travel to a GDG Garage for more than 15 minutes, you are doing it wrong, and you should create your own. Regular means it happens bi-weekly or more often.

Think of GDG Garage as a D&D session, but instead of dice and sheets of paper, you have laptops and code.

Or think of it as a local gym, but instead of excercising muscles, you excercise your coding skills.

Number of people is limited so hurry up and mark your seat at first GDG Garage in Zagreb.

For more info about GDG Garage click here http://gdg-garage.github.io/

For any further questions join us on slack http://bit.do/gdgzagreb-slack

We will also have snacks and drinks powered by Infinum to keep you fresh and creative.

events.name: Firebase Christmas Meetup + Codelab﻿⁠⁠⁠
events.description:
Together with JavaScript Meetup group we are super excited to announce our next event, dedicated to Firebase - a platform that helps to build better apps and grow a successful business.

On 14th of December we will host a meetup discussing Firebase infrastructure, giving tips and tricks of using Firebase in real projects, coupled together with a codelab session where you will be guided through making your first Android project with Firebase!

AGENDA

18:15 (Talks)

Goran Čolović  - DECODE
Fight Fire With Fire

In this talk we will cover basics of Firebase infrastructure and show how with Firebase you can build your apps easier. With features that work together, all in one place, you can Build your apps faster and focus on the things that matters the most.

18:45 (Codelabs)

Track 1 - Android

Marko Filipović- Freelance Android developer

In this codelab, you'll learn how to use the Firebase platform to easily create Android applications. You will implement a chat client and be able to monitor its performance using Firebase.

Track 2 - Web

Speaker TBD

In this codelab, you'll learn how to use the Firebase platform to easily create Web applications and you will implement and deploy a chat client using Firebase.

In the spirit of Christmas our Santa prepared some surprises so join us on this wonderful journey of Firebase Christmas Meetup.

Event is free, but RSVP is mandatory!

events.name: Dockerizing Java/GUI Applications
events.description:
We are proud to announce our next meetup which will be held together with Terminal Zagreb user group!

All of us, are sometimes forced to run the dreaded GUI applications! Josip will guides us on how to do it safely and securely, by keeping the evil imprisoned in the container by the Docker daemon!

AGENDA

18:00 (Talks)

Josip Maslać

Dockerizing Java/GUI Applications

One of the main founding ideas of Docker is to achieve that the environment used for application development is as similar as possible to the production one. That's not a simple task when development consists of using GUI applications (such as Eclipse). Josip played a bit and has managed to create such a setup. In this talk he will briefly explain the motivation behind it, obstacles he encountered and experience he's gained working on that solution.

18:30 (Lightning talks)

In this session you are all invited to do short ~5 minutes talks to showoff some cool stuff you did, start a debate on some topic or anything else related to the topic. :)

Robert Petranović

Terminal tips'n'tricks

Robert will show a short demo how to deploy home setup (.bashrc, .vimrc, .tmux.conf, bash complete...) to multiple servers in a heartbeat!

After the meetup, you're all welcome to discuss which application deserves the most of Docker daemon punishment, possibly with a beer in your hand at the Kolding bar nearby!

For any questions or suggestions find us on facebook or join us on our slack channel.

events.name: Google Hash Code Hub
events.description:
Think you could come up with a way to optimize the layout of a Google data center? Or how about routing Google Street View cars through a busy city?

Step into the shoes of a Google engineer and tackle similar challenges during Hash Code (g.co/hashcode), a team-based programming competition for students and professionals (18+) across Europe, the Middle East and Africa organized by Google. You pick your team and programming language, we pick a real-life engineering problem to solve. Are you up for the challenge?

We are hosting Hash Code Hub at KSET where we prepared cozy ambient and of course SWAG and goodies for the participants :), so make sure not to miss it and join us at our Hub so we can tackle together cool problems and have tons of fun along the way.

Registration is now open at g.co/hashcode.

The competition is divided into two stages:

Online Qualification Round

23rd February 2017, 18:30 - 22:30 CET

For this round, your team can participate from wherever you’d like, including one of our Hash Code hubs. Hubs allow for teams in the same location (eg. city or university) to compete side-by-side in a more fun and exciting environment.

Final Round

1st April 2017

Top scoring teams from the Online Qualification Round will be invited to Google Paris to compete in the Final Round of the competition.

In the meantime, join us and say hello at our slack channel or follow us on facebook.

events.name: Google Cloud Next Extended Zagreb
events.description:
Next ‘17 will be the largest event in Google’s history. Google Cloud engineers, customers, and partners will gather for inspiration and hands-on experiences with tools, technologies, and services born in the Cloud, including the latest developments from Google Cloud Platform, G Suite, Maps, and Devices.

We are bringing the Cloud Next magic to Zagreb with Next Extended edition where we will get the local developer community together to experience the keynote in real time, and learn about what Google Cloud offers today and hear from Google leaders Diane Greene, Sundar Pichai, and Eric Schmidt about Google Cloud's vision for the future.

To make this viewing party even more awesome we will bring some SWAG, and  drinks + snacks to keep you fresh during the whole event :wink:

AGENDA

17:30 - Welcome and networking

18:00 - Keynote/Session Streaming

19:30 - Talks

Cloudy with a Chance of Platform - Dinko Srkoč

Let me take you on a brief tour of some of the cloud services Google offers.
We'll start by visiting messaging service named Cloud Pub/Sub, stop at managed Spark that runs on Cloud Dataproc, marvel at historical sites such as Cloud Storage. Weather permitting, we'll even go out on a photo safari of Container Engine. We've hired some local guides, Cloud Console and Cloud SDK, that will lead us and get us close to some of the action that happens on those sites.

Dinko Srkoč has more than 17 years of professional experience moving bits around. His current role is that of data engineer at Instantor, where he uses cloudy technologies to play with data. Dinko graduated in 1998 from the University of Zagreb, Faculty of Electrical Engineering and Computing.

More details to come...

Until then find us on facebook or slack us on our slack channel with questions or suggestions :)

events.name: Google I/O Extended 2017
events.description:
With hands-on learning, technical talks, and Googlers on-hand to share their insights, Google I/O is returning for the second year at Shoreline Amphitheatre.

For the 2nd year, we are bringing the magic of I/O to Zagreb with I/O Extended where we will get the local developer community together to experience the keynote, in real time.

The event will be held at beautiful offices of Bellabeat HQ. To make this viewing party even more awesome, at the entrance we will have some SWAG waiting for you and of course drinks + snacks to keep you fresh during the whole event ;)

We have also prepared some very cool and exciting announcements so stay tuned!

AGENDA

18:00 - Welcome and networking

18:15 - Talks

19:00 - Keynote Livestream

TALKS

Backups, staging, release management, why do we do it - Goran Žuri

Developers love building features! This is our thing - we are always after the next killer feature. Backups, deployment plans, release management is somebody else’s problem, or is it? It can save us time, face and maybe even our job.

Our rockstar speaker, Goran Žuri, has more than 10 years of programming experience. Currently working as a development team lead for Sunhill Technologies a subsidiary of Volkswagen Group focusing on mobile payment solutions.

Check out some photos from last year..

And join us on our slack channel :D

events.name: Android Things Meetup
events.description:
Hi guys,

We are planing our first Android Things meetup. That cool technology finally came on our agenda. ;)

Google recently announced the Developer Preview for Android Things, a comprehensive way to build IoT products with the power and security of Android. Android Things is an exciting platform for Android developers because it enables building smart, connected devices using the same frameworks and tools they are familiar with. 

We have prepared short overview of Android Things with presentations and workshop including interesting tips and tricks.

AGENDA:

16:00 - Welcome and networking

16:30 - Intro to Android things ( Presentation ) - Mihael Franceković

17:15 - Intro to Android things ( Workshop ) - Mihael Franceković

18:15 - Knock-Knock Android Things Who is it? ( Presentation ) - Matej Vukosav

TALKS

Intro to Android things ( Presentation ) - Mihael Franceković

Let's see what Android things actually are. We will go through the base motive behind the Android things. We will see what we can do with the platform and why it might be useful for.

We will go briefly through the basics of electronics to prepare for the second part.

Intro to Android things ( Workshop ) - Mihael Franceković

Let's get physical, wire up some hardware and spin up the code.

There will be a hardware available for you to tweak and bring your first Android things project to life.

Knock-Knock Android Things Who is it? ( Presentation ) - Matej Vukosav

How can we make it practical? Hardware becomes super power when it is used with a mobile app. We will see how to connect doorbell (Android Thing) with a mobile app and see with a camera who is knocking on our doors. We can then decide and inform the doors in a real time (with mobile app) should it let a guest inside or not. 

We will also have snacks and drinks powered by Undabot to keep you fresh and creative.

Just a kind reminder to take your IDs because of the Eurotower’s (Undabot's location) security policy.

Until then find us on facebook or slack us on our slack channel with questions or suggestions :)

events.name: Google I/O Extended 2018
events.description:
I/O brings together developers from around the globe for talks, hands-on learning with Google experts, and a first look at Google’s latest developer products.

This year’s developer festival will be held May 8-10 at the Shoreline Amphitheatre in Mountain View, CA

We are bringing the magic of I/O to Zagreb with I/O Extended where we will get the local developer community together to experience the keynote, in real time.

The event will be held at beautiful offices of Five HQ. To make this viewing party even more awesome, at the entrance we will have some SWAG waiting for you and of course drinks + snacks to keep you fresh during the whole event ;)

We will also have some very cool and exciting announcements so stay tuned!

Until then.. Check out some photos from past years.. (https://goo.gl/photos/sQNmpPScQqRbv2mNA)

And join us on our slack channel (https://gdg-zagreb-slackin.herokuapp.com/) :D

events.name: Introduction to Machine Learning with Tensorflow
events.description:
Workshop led by Oleksandr Zakharchuk, Google Developers Expert
To attend the workshop, register here: https://goo.gl/YmhetU

This session is a quick tour of the machine learning basics. We will try our hand at classifying images from Fashion MNIST dataset using TensorFlow. The tasks will be performed in Collaboratory (colab.research.google.com). The only prerequisite for this session is ability to write and understand Python code. Please don’t forget to bring your laptop!

events.name: Practical ML with TensorFlow
events.description:
Workshop led by Oleksandr Zakharchuk, Google Developers Expert
To attend the workshop, register here: https://goo.gl/YmhetU

In this session, we’ll cover some of the practical aspects of using ML in startups. The topics will include using pre-trained models and transfer learning. You must know the basic ML concepts in order to benefit from this workshop. We advise you to go through the online Machine Crash Course if you have no prior experience with machine learning. The tasks will be performed in Collaboratory (colab.research.google.com). Please don’t forget to bring your laptop!

events.name: Assistive Apps with App Actions
events.description:
Engage billions of users across the Google Assistant by developing Actions and linking them with built-in intent catalog, making apps more aware, assistive and predictive.

AGENDA

19:00 - Welcome and networking

19:15 - Talks

TALKS

Making Android more assistive with App Actions
Elaine Dias Batista

In 2017, Google announced app predictions: 5 apps that are suggested to you on the App Drawer with a 60% prediction rate. This year, they are taking it to the next level: trying to predict the action that you are going to make at a specific time, depending on the context you're currently in and by analyzing your usage patterns based on machine learning algorithms that run locally on your phone. Those actions can be, for example, continue listening to Spotify if you plug in your headphones or call your best friend on friday nights. In this talk, I'll show how developers can take advantage of this concept by declaring the actions that your app does so Google can index it and suggest it to your users at the right time. I'll end by explaining that a building block of App Actions - Built-in Intents, can be then used to create a Conversational Action for the Google Assistant.

Elaine has been working with mobile apps for 5 years and has been passionate about Android development since then. The main reason is because a mobile phone is basically the computer that you always have with you and is always ready to help. This is why she has been paying so much attention to the Google Assistant since it was launched. Not only it is also always ready to help users accomplish their tasks, but it also enables them to do it in a natural way, using natural language. Her passion about the Google Assistant (and a lot of talks and workshops about it!) has granted her the title of GDE for the technology.

events.name: DevFest Croatia 2018
events.description:
GDG Zagreb and WTM Croatia are excited to announce that we are organizing the very first GDG DevFest in Croatia this year.

What is a DevFest?
GDG DevFests are large, community-run developer events happening around the globe, focused on community building and learning about Google technologies.
They cover multiple product areas such as Android, Firebase, Google Cloud Platform, Google Assistant, Flutter, machine learning with TensorFlow, and Mobile Web.

Each DevFest is inspired by and uniquely tailored to the needs of the developer community that hosts it. That’s why the first GDG DevFest Croatia will cover topics around Web, Mobile and Cloud technologies.

When&Where?
[masked]. from 9 AM to 2 PM at HUB385, Zagreb

What to expect?
As an attendee, you can expect speaker sessions, show-and-tell, job-speed-dating, workshops, IT quiz and much more! The sessions will be led by Google Developer Experts (GDEs), Google employees and other world-renown experts.

What are GDG Zagreb and WTM Croatia?
Google Developer Group Zagreb and Women Techmakers Croatia are groups of enthusiasts that gather around Google technologies. We organize different events - seminars, conferences or just dine-outs, and discuss the latest developments.

Disclaimer: GDG Zagreb and WTM Croatia are independent groups; our activities and the opinions expressed here should in no way be linked to Google, the corporation. To learn more about the GDG and WTM programs, visit https://developers.google.com/groups/

Rockstar speaker:
Martin Splitt, Google, Developer Advocate
Subject: Technical SEO tips for JavaScript web apps

WEB http://devfesthr.com/
TICKETS http://bit.ly/DevFest_Croatia

*Full agenda will be posted soon*

http://bit.ly/DevFest_Croatia_Event_Code_of_Conduct_and_Anti_Harrassment_Policy
